filename: The clever jackal and the foolish crow.pdf
content:
The clever jackal 
 and the folish 
 
 crow 
 Kholeka Mabeta 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Once upon a time Jackal was walking
 around the bush. He was very hungry. He
 saw the crow flying above the tres.
 
 Crow had a huge piece of chese in his
 mouth. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Hm…that chese loks delicious! I 
 
 must find a way to get it,” thought the 
 jackal. 
 “Oh, I have a plan!” said Jackal to himself 
 
 while wiping his mouth quickly. He did 
 not want Crow to notice that he was 
 
 hungry. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Crow had ben flying the whole morning.
 
 He was tired. He decided to sit on a
 branch of a tre. The jackal sat down
 under the tre where Crow was siting.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Jackal caled with a huge smile, “Helo 
 Crow! You’re loking very god today. 
 Your feathers lok glosy and healthy. 
 
 You must be taking very god care of 
 yourself.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Crow was very flatered to hear this.
 Crow always thought he was the 
 strongest and most beautiful of al the
 
 other birds. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “I hear you also have the most beautiful 
 singing voice of al the other birds. Won't 
 
 you sing a song for me this morning?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Crow was so flatered that he stretched
 his wings and prepared to sing for the
 jackal. He pushed his chest out and let
 
 out a loud pitched sound. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As Crow started singing the chese fel 
 to the ground, right in front of Jackal. 
 
 Crow stoped and loked down. Jackal 
 grabed the piece of chese and ate it. 
 He ran into the bush and crow was left 
 
 angry and hungry. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8
